website_summaries.verdict: Full-length cushioning that absorbs shock on hard floors, making these ideal for Zumba.
pros: Flexible rubber outsole molds and moves with natural foot movement
Contemporary retooling of a popular design with street-inspired colorway
cons: Cut very low around the ankle compared to other low-top sneakers

customer_reviews.title: Not a good work shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is very comfortable to wear while going for a walk or moderate walking through out the day. However, I needed a new pair of work shoes that would last through an 8-12 hour shift, and these were one of the worst shoes ive ever worn for a long period of time, standing on my feet. The memory foam sole is comfortable for a short while, and then the foam is squished all the way down and i feel like im standing on the hard ground. My heels ached after wearing these to work. One more good thing about this shoe is that the fabric near the toes allows for freedom and movement
customer_reviews.author: chad26

customer_reviews.title: BEST SHOE I'VE EVER WORN
customer_reviews.text: If I could give these shoes more than 5 stars I would. They are literally THE best, most comfortable athletic shoe I have ever worn. In fact, they are the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn, period. I wish I had found them sooner. I have wide feet and struggle with finding shoes that offer support and don't squeeze the daylights out of my feet. I also suffer from hereditary bunyuns and these shoes have changed my life. I can't reccomend them highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon J

customer_reviews.title: Basic shoe. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying these shoes strictly for comfort or maybe a little walking, they will be perfect. Do not expect them to last if you are doing any type of training that involves jumps or running (even though they are described as a Training Shoe). The cushion wears and in my pair, it has came loose from the sole. I am a little disappointed since this was my second pair of this style and the first pair lasted about twice as long. New Balance has been my go-to for a while now but I will probably research my options.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Super Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I love New Balance shoes and these don't disappoint! They're snazzy and comfy and super lightweight. I wear these only for cardio training (I have flat weight shoes for lifting) and am very pleased with them. The only negative is that NB tends to run a bit on the big side - something I knew as a long-time NB wearier and forgot. So I ordered a Wide and they fit, but they're a smidge too wide. Not enough for me to return them, but I don't run or do classes like zumba, etc. If you do and you wear wide, I recommend getting it first in standard size. If you aren't happy, you can exchange them.
customer_reviews.author: Angela865

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable. I needed a new pair of gym shoes. I only wear them at the gym, not outside or anything, so they stay clean. I work out about 3-5 times a week in these. Running on the treadmill and weight sessions. The memory foam soles are very comfortable. I'm usually an 8 in athletic shoes and that was the case with these. I'd say they fit true to size. Also, I should note, they were labeled as "wide" but I have narrow feet and they don't feel wide. They feel normal. So for wide feet, I'm not sure if they'd work well.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for walking, not for training
customer_reviews.text: While these shoes are definitely comfortable enough for everyday walking around town, they are not good for training, which is what they are sold as. They do not offer enough arch support so not good for jumping jacks and my feet were rolling around in them so not good for squats/lunges. Maybe get a d for weightlifting since they are relatively flat. Also, I wear size 9 in every single brand, in some brands I am a 9W, but, always a 9. However, in New Balance, even 9.5 is too short so I recommend going 1 size up.
customer_reviews.author: sexysherri

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of NB 577v4 Cush. I have two other pairs of NB shoes (different series) and they just don’t compare to these! The all day comfort can’t be beat! I normally wear a size 8 in shoes but I know (based on experience) to go up 1/2 a size in these. Definitely won’t be my last pair.
customer_reviews.author: Richelle Keilholz

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble with my other New Balances, but decided to buy these since they are offered in wide width and I read reviews. I have pain in my feet which is barely noticeable when I wear these. I feel great, and can walk for much longer. I've even jogged with no more pain in my shins. These shoes have helped me a lot and I'm excited to continue on my exercise journey with these. My feet are no longer a distraction. I ordered one half size up than usual since my other pair was hitting my toe. Most shoes I can wear 6.5W, New balance, I seem to fit better in a 7W.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these shoes! From the moment I put them on I was in foot heaven. I was always a medium width until bunions and flat feet became an issue; resisting going to a wide width. I read reviews and went up to 8.5 size from my normal 8, it was a good decision. The memory foam insoles are so comfy the only complaint would be not much of an arch. They are very attractive in person and will be my fall/winter sneakers for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: With the shelter in place order due to covid-19 I've been doing a lot more walking and needed a pair of lightweight and comfortable shoes. These are absolutely perfect. I've been walking over 5 miles every day for the past month in these sneaks, I'm flat-footed, have a bunyon on my right foot and live in a very hilly part of Seattle - I haven't experienced an ounce of foot discomfort or shoe wear and tear. Now, I did by the wide shoes in my normal size (5.5) so that may aid in the comfort but seriously, these are a dream. I'm actually about to order another pair in a different color...
customer_reviews.author: SmallRedHead

customer_reviews.title: Order a half size up
customer_reviews.text: These are SO comfy! They require zero break-in time. I order wide to fit custom orthotics, as well as a half size up. They are noticeably smaller than my other sneakers, but because they're so thin, and it's not really my size, I can get away with it. Definitely not for heavy walking or hiking, as they aren't stiff and supportive, these are a great casual show for light, easy wear. Would love to get them in another color as well!
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cross training
customer_reviews.text: I recently started cross training and my running shoes felt too heavy and not right. I wanted a pair of cross trainers, but I wasn't sure if they would really make a difference. These shoes are perfect - and yes - they do make a difference. They are very comfortable and the work outs are so much more effective. And they're cute! I always take a 6.5 and they run true to size. I wouldn't run in them because I need more stability for that. I think they'd be great for doing errands around town too - I might need to buy another pair :)
customer_reviews.author: bostoni

customer_reviews.title: not one of their better models
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing NB for YEARS. Have to say this is not one of their better models. Lacks support throughout the shoe. Even if I add inserts, the exterior materials are weak and last is too flexible. Perhaps use a more stable fabric, firmer last, and enhance the cushioning for shock.. Overall, I felt like I was walking on rocks with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick in MN

customer_reviews.title: Not a shoe for someone who's on their feet all day
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of the shoe and was hoping it would fit and feel like the NB shoe I currently have and use for work. This shoe fits like its made smaller so by the end of my 9 hour shift, my feet are throbbing. I'll end up giving these shoes away and look for a more comfortable one.
customer_reviews.author: freakgirl11

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit, lightweight, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable for a shoe to just wear. I have a narrow foot, and these are almost too tight in the toe box. As for working out, they are very lightweight, with minimal support, as expected. The inner soul is already slipping and pushing forward. I am disappointed in that, as I’ve only had them a couple of weeks. Hopefully replacing that will help. Overall, I like the shoe, but will probably wear them for casual use over working out.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay H

customer_reviews.title: It a trick
customer_reviews.text: This shoe came in and I was so excited. Then I tried them on. Well tried to put it on. I wear a 7 and ordered a 7. This shoe was way too small. My daughter wears a 6.5 and it just barely went on. I tried to reorder a larger size in the same shoe when returning it but the price of the exact same shoe was 3 times more. This is a scam
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This was a surprisingly good walking shoe. I wanted a more casual shoe that I could wear on a trip that involved a lot of walking. I typically wear high-end running shoes, so was skeptical that the memory foam lining with so little arch support would carry me as long as they did, but I don't require a lot of arch support. This could be more of an issue for someone with high arches.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I was having ankle problems in my Nikes and I'm so glad I made the switch to these! Super lightweight, the memory foam does wonders...and now I'm walking more than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Moran

customer_reviews.title: Not really a cross trainer
customer_reviews.text: This are a cute shoe. I got them for cross training but due to the insole they kept slipping off while I was lifting. I would not recommend them for the purpose of cross training. I am in the health field and wore them to work. They worked great for that. Comfy and light. They are ok for a sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: These run a full size too small, insole worthless
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an similar older pair from a different brand. I like the lightweight feel and casual look, but stylish enough for daily wear. These have such a thin insole that doesn't fit properly in the shoe and has barely any cushion. It wrinkled up and I can feel that through my socks. The shoe itself runs a full size too small, but the insole is true to size. I even double checked to make sure that I wasn't accidently sent the wrong size. I usually really like NB brand, and this is the first pair that didn't cut it for me.
customer_reviews.author: E. K. Chapa

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I have planters fasciitis and these are awesome with my insoles. They have the right amount of cushion and support for my feet to make it all day teaching. I do recommend sizing up. These do run small.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: These shoes started coming apart at the sole the week I got them. After a few wears, the black part of the sole had completely separated. I sent them back. They are cushy and soft but just do not hold up
customer_reviews.author: RedDixieCup

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised: Not a Cross-training shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I can say is suze fits as expected. I bought these to work out in... walk, jog, bike ride etc... Took them out of the box and for a 10 mile bike ride. These are listed as cross training shoes but wouldn't say they are fit for more than around the house sneakers. Little arch support. Memory foam is thin and really serves no purpose. The balls of my feet don't feel cushioned at all either. If I didn't just go for a long qork out I would absolutely return these.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Melanson

customer_reviews.title: These shoes weren't for me.
customer_reviews.text: I usually like New Balance but something about these shoes made my feet experience sharp pains in the side after walking in them for less than 30 minutes. My feet don't usually have pain like that. I sent them back for a refund. This model just might not have been for me, I'll most likely still try New Balance again in the future; if you're curious, my shoe size is 10W in women's.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These are a a shoe that you get for running errands or going on short walks. They are not good shoes for standing at work all day or exercising. They don’t offer anything close to the support of the 700+ series New Balance and don’t even feel like the same brand. They offer virtually no arch support. If you are looking for a good solid shoe put your money towards and more expensive shoe and skip these. But they are a good looking shoes and I will use them for casual purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft  and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think there is a dislike Perfect love em.
customer_reviews.author: misscuddie

customer_reviews.title: Helped with Shin Splints
customer_reviews.text: After a couple years of a hiatus from running, I recently started working out at OrangeTheory. I was getting killer shin splints on the treadmill. My coach recommended looking into new shoes (I had Nike running shoes at that time.) Changed over to these New Balances and the shin splints are gone. I have semi-wide feet and these are a little tight at first, but have loosened up a little in the last couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: beks

customer_reviews.title: Slim profile, fine for light workout, some manufacturing issues
customer_reviews.text: These look nice, not too bulky, but there are some manufacturing issues. These are the 3rd pair of these I purchased due to some noticeable flaws/stitching differences between the left and right on the other pairs I bought. Might be a good idea to get a few, keep the good pair, return the others like I had to do. I mean they're pretty cheap so whatever, but it was a PITA to keep buying and returning. Fine for light workout or walking/light hike. Probably not supportive enough for most people for running, long, strenuous hikes or major workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: "MEH"
customer_reviews.text: Fit seems a little big to me- but not enough to send back. Support is definitely minimal- I've had NB shoes in the past, these were a slightly disappointment. Cute for here and there wear but will not be making these my daily shoes
customer_reviews.author: MAN2019

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but noisy
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers fit true to size and they're pretty comfortable overall. However, they take the "sneak" out of sneaker because they squeak when you walk in them. It's a bit awkward... picture yourself on a nature hike with a friend. Just you, your friend, the sound of the air, the birds, the leaves rustling and then.... squeak, squeak, squeak, squeak.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: It is hard for me to find shoes to fit my feet. These are awesome, they are not heavy, and they provide great support. I'd gone to several stores in the area and in a city close to us and it was a waste of time. Came to Amazon just to see what was here, and lo and behold, I found these great shoes. And they are great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: I. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pregnant feet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 8 months pregnant and my regular shoes weren’t cutting it. My feet were getting fatigued really quickly. I got these and put some bungee laces on them and now these are the only shoes I wear. It feels like I’m wearing slippers around, but with great support! I can not recommend these enough. If you are pregnant or know someone who is, get these! I wear a 7.5 in new balance and I got my normal size.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Super Cute and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I really love these shoes. They feel like the soles are made of memory foam. I am a New Balance devotee. These fit a bit different than my typical 515 or 574s. The toe box is a little bit more narrow and less rounded. Anyways, I think they will make great walking/cross training shoes. The first day I wore them I was on a walking tour of some facilities for work and they were comfortable all day.
customer_reviews.author: Alysson H. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Missized
customer_reviews.text: I always wear New Balance and these Vietnam-made shoes are almost 2 inches shorter than another pair I bought at the same time. I bought an 8.5 and would say the ones I got are actually about a 7. Also apart from the size issue, since other people say theirs fit - just be aware these are not your typical sturdy new balance cross trainers - they are very lightweight like a tennis shoe.
customer_reviews.author: meli

customer_reviews.title: SOOO comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I want to wear them everywhere. I have never had shows with memory foam and it definitely makes a difference! They look cute and they're comfortable. They fit accurate to size. I would buy them again in a minute!
customer_reviews.author: apelchar

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how comfortable these shoes actually are (from the very first wear)! No need to break them in, and they fit true to size. I also like the extra cushion you feel on the inside; my feet feel more balanced and stable when I wear them. The only thing is that I do wear thinner socks (e.g., cheap hanes low cut socks from walmart), but I think it may get a little snug if you tend to use socks that are thicker.
customer_reviews.author: M.Y.

customer_reviews.title: These are great but at least for me, they run just a little small
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable. I wear a 9.5 but ordered a 10. They were a bit tight but after wearing them just an hour, the entire shoe top to bottom conformed to my foot. They look great with the pink and black but they are mostly black so the pink isn't obnoxious like many other shoes. They look good with any shade of blue jeans and because they are not big and bulky, they look good with leggings. I'm buying another pair so I have the shoes I love for when they change styles
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Habermeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfort, and handling overall!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of shoes to say the very least, with all of the comforts that New Balance often specializes in. I ordered this in a wide width, the overall fit is perfect for all of my fitness needs and daily routine. The memory foam provides the best comfort and handling while walking and/or running about. Best shoe bargain for the money paid!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy-Roxie Harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes for everyday work, not so much for exercise
customer_reviews.text: I work at an office that requires me to go out to the warehouse and walk a lot. These shoes are proving to be very comfortable for that purpose. I took them with me to go on a quick 30 min hike on a trail, not so comfortable. However I don't really plan on using them for that purpose- I prefer these for work.
customer_reviews.author: parumey

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my size in a wide and got what I ordered but the shoe seems to run narrow at short at the toes. The memory foam is soft and comfortable but doesn’t have any support. If you just want some “I’m not walking a lot” shoes to run to the store then these are great. If you want good workout shoes then keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Ra

customer_reviews.title: The comfort and fit of this shoe is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: The comfort and fit of this shoe is like a glove, I love them. The first pair I bought was for running. Accidentally wore them while mixing concrete and messed them up. I love the shoes so much that I bought them a second time around. So now I have a pair I will work in like cut the grass and the second pair for running only lol
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Casselberry

customer_reviews.title: A good running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable for running. The memory foam is too thin for long term standing. Your feet will be in pain after 4 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: Not as I thought
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were very cool looking, but I thought they were lace up shoes not slip-ons. I can't get them on because of high arches . They have been returned. I think the description could have been more clear.
customer_reviews.author: Casay

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: Sure wish New Balance would bring these back! I bought an extra pair for when my current ones wear out. Wore them non-stop on our last vacation and had no foot discomfort. I love how light they are; I have fibromyalgia and anything that makes it easier for me to get around is much appreciated!
customer_reviews.author: bmwark

customer_reviews.title: No Arch Support!
customer_reviews.text: A bit too roomy. I have wide feet, but this shoe is VERY wide. Thicker socks does the trick. Disappointed in lack of good arch support.... there isn't any!
customer_reviews.author: Bubbe J

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I walk about five and a half miles every day, and I ordered these shoes for that purpose. I wasn't sure about them at first, because they felt quite different from my other New Balance walking shoes. After wearing them for about four days, I am very happy with them. They are extremely comfortable and very light weight. Although they don't appear to be as substantial as my other shoes, they do offer excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Conte

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about a month now, and so far so good. I get shin splints very easily and these have helped prevent that on days when I'm on my feet a lot. Super light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kyla C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes. True to size & great for lifting weights or squatting because they are flat soled. Very nice and basic design.
customer_reviews.author: SamBour

customer_reviews.title: Buy bigger
customer_reviews.text: Shoes run about a 1/2 size smaller than expected. Don't fit like in store shoes. I wear 9.5 but often buy 10's... these have no room and my toe is at the very end of toe or box. So I need a 10.5. I never buy 10.5. So go up at least a half size.
customer_reviews.author: LanellKeith

customer_reviews.title: Bottom rubber coming off
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in July for the gym . I only wear them for one hr four days a week. And I didn’t even go for two months. So I’m very disappointed In The fact that the rubber on Bottom is coming off. On both shoes this is the first pair of shoes I’ve ever had this problem.That’s my only complaint they for great and are very Comfortable
customer_reviews.author: carrie

customer_reviews.title: BEST SHOES EVER, Super Comfy, look clean, Bough 2pair there so good.
customer_reviews.text: BEST SHOES IVE EVER BOUGHT!!!!! I love them so much I bought another pair. I got an 8.5 wide and I promise you my feet don’t hurt like they’ve been doing and it feels like I’m walking on air with the memory foam inserts. These shoes are amazing and I swear by them. So much I had to buy another pair of the same damn shoes for when these finally wear out I’ll have another pair to replace them with when I’m ready. Lol I promise this will be your next favorite pair of shoes. I bought them for walking but I’ve been wearing them everywhere even around the house lol 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Ashley doering

customer_reviews.title: New Balance is BEST
customer_reviews.text: After having gone away from New Balance because I could not source them locally, going back to the light, comfortable New Balance line is amazing. I have Planer Faciatis and the other shoes made i worse. Not to mention that the other, more expensive, shoes only lasted 3 months. I have never had New Balance break down like that. They are also very good looking shoes and did not have a break in time. BTW: Do not fly Spirit Airlines!
customer_reviews.author: Alice V. Conn

customer_reviews.title: love these!!
customer_reviews.text: Skechers are getting too expensive, so thought I'd give these a try due to the memory foam advertisement. The New Balance shoes are equally as comfortable and fit well at a better price! Love these! My only con is the fact that they are lace up.
customer_reviews.author: LD 825571

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sporty
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I found my first pair at JC Penney and bought my second pair on Amazon and will likely purchase them again when they wear out. I am constantly standing and walking around at work and these are super comfortable for me. I was having troubles with pain and varicose veins and I don’t notice those when I wear these.
customer_reviews.author: majesticmoose88

customer_reviews.title: Not for high impact activities
customer_reviews.text: Not as supportive or cushiony as I expected; good for casual use and non high-impact activities. I wore these in a HIIT class, and I could uncomfortably feel hotspots forming on the bony sides of my feet during lateral movements and the balls of my feet during lunges. I switched to Nike's Foundation Elite TR shoes and found those to be very comfortable, supportive, cushiony, and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: PNWGirl

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these were the perfect shoe felt great. After a couple of weeks they are horrible. They have no support feels like you are walking on the ground. After wearing them my plantar fasciitis hurts even more. Doesn't happen with my Nikes
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Davis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. These are my “every day” shoes, so I am not working out in them. I would do light workouts in them, but they would not be good (for me) for jogging. They are very comfortable and the size was exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfort.  Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: I also wrote a review for the same shoe in blue. These are excellent fitness shoes. i wanted them for strength training twice a week. I got not only nice comfort, but also a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Walkers not cross trainers
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fall off back of heel when I do mountain climbers or planks. Otherwise comfortable. Just would only use for walking, not gym.
customer_reviews.author: anniem

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is very comfortable and super lightweight. I use it for working out at home. I use an elliptical and do some light weights, so nothing crazy. I am not sure if it would be supportive enough someone who works on their feet all day, but it's comfy for me!
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable- walking on clouds. Needs more support.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable because of the memory foam, but do not have a ton of support. The memory foam should be a little more firm to give some support. They are nice for walking. They were true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Josh N

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so incredibly comfortable! I love them. It’s like walking on a cloud. I use them to work out and they work very well. My feet are sensitive and I find most tennis shoes don’t provide support but these shoes do. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Anilem

customer_reviews.title: Flights off the back of my foot sometimes, but they are adorable!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes overall, but my one complaint is that the heel always kind of slides off the back of my foot when I do certain workout moves. They are so cute, though, I will keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Love these sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive about buying sneakers online but was extremely surprised that they were more than I expected! Absolutely love them and actually felt, performed and looked better than the expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Logrippo

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit
customer_reviews.text: These don't fit the way New Balance normally does, they're tighter across the top in a way that cannot be loosened with the laces. I had to give them away after wearing them a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Hoped for more
customer_reviews.text: True to size that part was hugely important. Not too narrow in the toes at all. However after constant use since my purchase in may the comfort levels have diminished greatly. I understand in my line of work of constantly moving managing at least 10 miles everyshift long lasting is asking a lot. But 3 months is not a lot of time. I had hoped for more durability. Fyi the treads start to wear in away that it feels stuck to the floor some days. The rest of the shoes integrity is sound however.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Night

customer_reviews.title: true to size
customer_reviews.text: use the sneaker for walking. I was happy that they fit since 5.5 is hard size to get- not a size available in many stores. Fairly cushy but not as cushy as the ones I used to get when sneakers first became popular
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight
customer_reviews.text: This New Balance cross trainer shoe is very very light weight. Maybe that is a requirement of a cross trainer shoe? The sole is cushy yet thin. Still deciding, but it’s a quality shoe, as are all New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: New favorite shoeshiner
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, super comfortable, and matches everything. Also priced less than my retailer near me. Win win!!!
customer_reviews.author: sadie

customer_reviews.title: Too wide with no stabilization
customer_reviews.text: The heel is cozy and fits good. The toe box is too big and doesn't stabilize the ball of your feet. I felt like I was fighting balancing on one foot because the ball of my foot was constantly falling off the shoe. Returned. Price does not justify the struggle and discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’m on my feet 10 hours a day and so far this is the only shoes that keeps my feet from hurting. The only downside is that I’m on my feet 10 hours a day so they wear out pretty quick so I suggest buying more than one.
customer_reviews.author: RdTutt

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light to wear.
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly ordered wrong size but my wife did like the shoe so I reordered the correct size. This is an update: After wearing the shoe for several days, my wife really enjoys these after I received the correct size. Great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New Balance 577 Black Heather size 8 1/2 B
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for me because I needed a little bit wider shoe. I have a pair of size 8 B of the exact same shoes. I'm wearing a thin brace on my foot right now and these fit much better. I'm not sure that they are any longer? But it is important to note, that if you have a narrow foot, these are a little wider. All of the numbers on both pairs are identical except The 8 B's are 25 cm wide and the 8 1/2 B's are 25.5 cm wide. Doesn't sound like much, but the 8 1/2 shoe is more comfortable for me.
customer_reviews.author: JJ43

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, order 1/2 size up
customer_reviews.text: Amazon site recommended ordering 1/2 size up for this sneaker, I usually wear 9, 9 1/2 fit perfect. I really like the gray color, and good comfort for being on my feet a lot of the day at work.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: perfect shoe
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear an 11 b/c I have a wide foot (and no one ever has a 10.5 let alone wide!) but ordered the 10 Wide in these. They fit SOOO comfy and are so light on the feet! Hoping they last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: NenRay

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and great fit
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite cross trainers to date. The Cush technology in the bottom is very comfortable and my feet have plenty of room. I typically wear a 9 or a 9.5 in shoes and I got a 9 in these and they fit perfectly. My only gripe is that I wish there were more color options because I would probably buy multiple pairs!
customer_reviews.author: Tori B

customer_reviews.title: I have problems with nerves in my feet and this has helped them.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable but offer great support. I can tell they set my foot at the proper angle for walking. My hip pain from walking wrong has almost gone away.
customer_reviews.author: Camilla Stradley

customer_reviews.title: I want to return these but it's too late
customer_reviews.text: I've had these sneakers for 4 months and they've torn at the toe. Also, not very good for long duration of wearing, not cushioned enough for long walks.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: They look nice and feel nice
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes, they look just like the picture. They fit ok, i like the memory foam inside the shoes. The one thing that i do not like it that the heel part of the shoe is to flexible and doesn't hold my foot in the shoe 100%. Not sure if i would buy them again. For $50 there are better fitting shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These Cross trainers are perfect for my new workout regimen which is now strength training. They are perfect in size and fit secure when working. They keep my feet planted well on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: MBR

customer_reviews.title: Not New Balance quality.
customer_reviews.text: I order New Balance because of the support for my narrow feet and for the general quality. Though I like the look OK, I found these shoes to be thin, with little support or insole, even for walking shoes. They resemble a common brand I avoid due to these undesirable characteristics.
customer_reviews.author: HDG-H

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So I haven’t bought new shoes in forever, my heal has been hurting and that’s why I bought these, tried them on and they fit, the pain in my heal is gone! I didn’t give it five stars because I’m reading all of the other reviews and they are all saying that these won’t last long... so I guess I’ll see. So far these fit great and again, the pain in gone ! Also lower back pain has eased down a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Simone Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting shoes
customer_reviews.text: I was in a bad wreck and had to learn to walk again in 1997 and New Balance were the shoes I got and they were perfect. I've bought other brands over the years but I am thrilled to say I'll Never go without New Balance again. The fit is very comfortable and not heavy shoes making walking so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy T

customer_reviews.title: As comfortable as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are as comfortable as advertised. Just a bit on the small side. I’d advise to get a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: mafeno

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: Great quality shoe. I have a normal to wide foot but I have always worn regular width in New Balance. However, this pair was very narrow. A coworker was able to wear them and she said they are very comfortable, she has very narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love New Balance. Only shoe I’ll wear fit working. Great design. Great color choices. Great price point. Always get compliments on my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri G.

customer_reviews.title: Color and style loomed great as in ther photos but I exchanged for different ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not have arch support that I feel that NB usually offers. Felt thin and cheaply made. Stiff, not soft. Gel didnt cushion heel very well, only felt it in for area. Color and style loomed great as in ther photos but I exchanged for different style.
customer_reviews.author: KATY

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable shoes. They are not as wide as the normal New Balance shoes I normally get so I can't fit my planter fasciitis inserts into them, but so far that hasn't been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A Shoshone

customer_reviews.title: NOT MADE IN USA!
customer_reviews.text: This product claims to be made in the USA. I didn't think to check the tag until I wore them to work the first day, if I had I would have returned them. They are comfortable but seem to run small. I normally only purchase made in USA shoes and am quite irritated that I didn't check before wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Bought my second pair. I wear them to gym and running.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit & feel!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They’re very light and comfortable to wear with or without socks. I’m tempted to buy a couple more pairs to have on hand when these wear out, or if I step in dog poo. I’m extremely picky about how my shoes fit and feel. I don’t have a single bad thing to say about these!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great for walking and working out. I used them last week on a light hike which included rocky terrain and they were comfortable and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable to wear. The only thing I have a problem with is the length I ordered my norm size and with these my toe is at the very end. I still find them comfortable to wear though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and true to size
customer_reviews.text: My husband turn me on to new balance sneakers. I always wore nikes. I’m so glad I listen to him. What a difference. I’m very active in the spring/ summer. I walk long distance, jog, bike, and do weight training. These seem to fit the bill. Very comfortable. I saw where a lot of reviews say they ran small. I think they fit true to my size. I haven’t had a chance to put them through a full season of my activity. My nikes I had to replace twice a season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I work on my feet so I needed a comfortable shoe that was also firm and supported my foot
customer_reviews.text: I had a foot injury and have been wearing very expensive shoes and inserts lately. I work on my feet so I needed a comfortable shoe that was also firm and supported my foot. These have definitely stood against the test of restaurant work.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Two TOES up! I am on my feet most of the day while working, these shoes are fantastic! Super lightweight and comfortable. The memory foam inside provides excellent arch support. I will buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Carly Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a second pair, after I bought first pair at a store. They didn't have this color. Fit just the same. Love that the heel is soft. And foam inserts are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and supportive
customer_reviews.text: First night walking in and they were super comfy for my chubby feet. They have good support and my feet didn’t hurt after a 2 mile walk.
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty comfortable. I stand much of the day so that's good. They're not too tight but haven't worn with socks yet but believe it will still feel alright.
customer_reviews.author: C.B

customer_reviews.title: So Comfortable and Light and Speedy Delivery
customer_reviews.text: I do not like purchasing shoes, especially online as I struggle with finding comfortable and well-fitti!!ng shoes. What a great surprise when these arrived quickly, as ordered, and were not only lightweight but fit like they were made for me! I will be buying these again. Oh, I also don't like buying shoes because they cost so much, but these were VERY reasonably priced for New Balance. Thank You, Thank You, Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Ruby C. Potter

product_meta.title: New Balance Women's 577 V4 Cross Trainer
product_meta.description: Featuring a cush+ midsole and full memory sole insert for ultimate cushioning and comfort, the wx577v4 was built with the purist in mind. Performance she needs, comfort she desires and the style she craves -- recognizable and trustworthy, this is her go-to gym shoe.
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately low-top from arch
